column5: Has anyone tried this type of jig with a spinner blade on it of walleyes on Lac Seul?I just bought some blades for spinner leaders and added a few to the order.They looked great when I put them in one of the jig boxes.Tipped with a minnow,leech or chunk of crawler they out to be great.Bill

I have used jigs with spinners in Lac Seul. Cought so many fish hard to tell if there was a difference with spinners or not. Some times color made a difference. The biggest factor was how many snags. In real snag infested areas I used cheaper jigs. Have fun trying to figure it out.Rod

I've never fished Lac Seul but the Road Runner is my favorite jig of all time. In NW Ontario I probably jig about half my walleye fishing time and about half of that is with a Road Runner. 1/8 or 1/4 oz., chartreuse, half a crawler. If the Road Runner does not have the fuzzy body, add a yellow twister tail. Give 'em a try, especially when a regular jig isn't working or the bit slows down.
Bill, I have had great results using the bladed jigs on LS! Good luck!
that type of jig will work great, especially in a current situation. You may have to up size due to the extra drag the spinner offers.
Easily my favorite jig style. Like them so much we bought the mold and pour our own. Pain in the arse getting those little swivels on for the spinners though.
Not on 'Seul, but we use them on Cedar and they seem to out produce regular jigs in most situations.
